alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Brewster; Crane; Ector; Jeff Davis; Loving; Midland; Pecos; Reeves; Upton; Ward; Winkler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 02 at 12:03PM CST until March 02 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Southern Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Western Andrews County in western Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Southwestern Midland County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Northern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... East central Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Winkler County in western Texas... Loving County in western Texas... Western Upton County in western Texas... * Until 130 PM CST/1230 PM MST/. * At 1202 PM CST/1102 AM MST/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Eunice Airport to 6 miles west of Kermit to 9 miles west of Grandfalls to 21 miles northwest of Fort Stockton to 13 miles southeast of Balmorhea Lake, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satelllite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 210 and 294. Interstate 20 between mile markers 38 and 121. Locations impacted include... Odessa, Pecos, Fort Stockton, Monahans, Kermit, Crane, Eunice, Jal, McCamey, Wink, Mentone, Thorntonville, Grandfalls, Barstow, Goldsmith, Pyote, Jal Airport, West Odessa, Saragosa and Balmorhea Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Andrews; Brewster; Crane; Ector; Jeff Davis; Loving; Midland; Pecos; Reeves; Upton; Ward; Winkler
